definition: Xishi (c. 450 BC), famous Chinese beauty, foremost of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3], given by King Gou Jian 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4] of Yue as concubine to King of Wu as part of a successful plan to destroy Wu
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
west
surname Shi
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
lit. in the eyes of a lover appears 西施[Xi1 shi1] (idiom); fig. beauty is in the eye of the beholder
pinyin: qing2 ren2 yan3 li3 chu1 Xi1 shi1

definition: In the eyes of the lover, a famous beauty (idiom). Beauty in the eye of the beholder
pinyin: qing2 ren2 yan3 li3 you3 Xi1 shi1

definition: betel nut beauty: a skimpily-dressed, attractive girl who sells betel nut from a glass-walled roadside booth (Tw)
shih tzu (dog breed)

sentences.english: This may seem like a rampant game actually only designed by xishi appeared.
sentences.chinese: 這看似猖獗的遊戲實則只爲西施自行現身而設計。

sentences.english: It's called love is blind, I think.
sentences.chinese: 我想這是情人眼裏出西施吧。

sentences.english: This pool, clear to the bottom, is said to be the "Xi Shi River Port".
sentences.chinese: 這水池清澈見底，傳說是“西施河埠”。

sentences.english: Pabu, their Shih Tzu, has not adjusted as well.
sentences.chinese: 他們的西施狗小布也還未適應。

sentences.english: But, as far as embryos go, beauty is often in the eye of the beholder, Holte says.
sentences.chinese: 但是，胚胎的選擇和評估，也是情人眼裏出西施。

sentences.english: So beautiful is Xi Shi that we all like her。
sentences.chinese: 西施是如此美麗，以致於我們都喜歡她。

sentences.english: Miss Xishi was loved widely, while there were some people to love Miss Dongshi.
sentences.chinese: 西施有人愛，東施不見得就沒有人喜歡。

sentences.english: But is in the eyes of the beholder, exactly.
sentences.chinese: 但是情人眼裏出西施，一點都不錯。

sentences.english: Why does your friend care if you know his dog's a Shih Tzu?
sentences.chinese: 朋友幹嘛要在意你是否知道他家的狗是西施犬呢？

sentences.english: As she was extremely beautiful, when she went to the river to wash the gauze.
sentences.chinese: 因爲長得非常漂亮，西施在河裏浣紗的時候。

sentences.english: Dark, such as bathing chaise, light-colored like Huan yarn.
sentences.chinese: 深色的如出浴貴妃，淺色的像渙紗西施。

sentences.english: And what made you decide to start taking pictures of betel nut girls?
sentences.chinese: 什麼讓你決定去拍檳榔西施的？

sentences.english: Your eyes are pools in Heshbon, by the gate of Bathrabbim.
sentences.chinese: 你的眼目像西施本巴特那拉並門旁的水池。

sentences.english: What is the reason for this?
The Poodle and the Shih Tzu completed the top 10.
sentences.chinese: 同時躋身前十名的還有獅子狗和西施犬。

definition: Fan Li (536-488 BC), politician of Yue state, businessman and economist
King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
the four legendary beauties of ancient China, namely: Xishi 西施[Xi1 shi1], Wang Zhaojun 王昭君[Wang2 Zhao1 jun1], Diaochan 貂蟬|貂蝉[Diao1 Chan2] and Yang Yuhuan 楊玉環|杨玉环[Yang2 Yu4 huan2]
King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
another name for Xishi 西施[Xi1 shi1]
beauty unmatched in her generation (idiom); woman of peerless elegance/prettiest girl ever
beauty/belle
lit. fish sink, goose alights (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); fig. female beauty captivating even the birds and beasts

Yang Yuhuan 楊玉環|杨玉环[Yang2 Yu4 huan2] or Yang Guifei (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
Baosi, concubine of King You of Zhou 周幽王[Zhou1 You1 wang2] and one of the famous Chinese beauties
Wu Zixu (-484 BC), powerful politician in Wu/famous as destitute refugee begging in Wu town, cf 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫
a woman of unmatched beauty (idiom)
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
to wash silk
famous courtesan
